name: Aggie Adaptive Sports
description:
Our purpose is to facilitate adaptive sports as a healthy form of recreation to students, veterans, and community members in an effort to promote the physical and mental benefits that adaptive sports possess. We strive to bring veterans and students, disabled and able-bodied, together in a safe arena that will promote a sense of community between individuals in a variety of circumstances with differing levels of ability.

Email List

Join our listserv (email list) to keep up with planned events, suggest activities and find out other ways to get involved.

AAS in the News

  • Aggie Adaptive Sports Honored at Spring 2014 Diversity Awards with the "Gary Grey Memorial Award"
  • Aggie Adaptive Sports expands athletic norms (The Battalion, February 2014)
  • USA Sitting Volleyball Promo (YouTube, December 2013) - with Texas A&M University Former student, Rejy Bacchus
  • All Access: Aggies Roll! (NCAA website, Fall 2013) - feature on Wheelchair Soccer event by Olivia Ekpone
  • Veterans Week on BVTM: Aggie Adaptive Sports (KBTX, November 2013)
  • Group for disabled Aggie veterans holds first event (The Eagle, October 2013)
  • Honoring our Heros Fundaiser for AAS (KBTX, September 2013)
